Description of incident: A former Texas Lottery Commission              computer analyst has been arrested for copying the personal data of              Texas lottery winners. He downloaded his own work files off his computer              and took them to his next job. The names and Social Security numbers              of 27,075 mid-level lottery winners -- people who have won prizes              from $600 up to around $1 million -- were on the employee's hard drive. UPDATE 10/31/08: 89,000 lottery winners are being notified their personal information, including Social Security numbers, may have been breached.
